Title: Golar LNG in advanced negotiations to redeploy Hilli FLNG unit
Description: Bermuda-headquartered LNG infrastructure player Golar LNG is in detailed contract negotiations regarding the redeployment of its 126,227 m3 Hilli Episeyo floating LNG (FLNG) unit after the end of its current charter which runs out in July 2026.
Author: JS

Title: Santos to supply 0.4 mtpa of LNG to Hokkaido Gas over 10 years from 2027
Description: Australian energy producer Santos has agreed to supply about 0.4 mtpa of LNG to Japanese gas utility Hokkaido Gas over 10 years, starting in 2027.
Author: CK

Title: Brunei LNG restarts onshore compressor plants following outage last week
Description: Brunei LNG said today that it has returned its onshore compressor plants to operation following a shutdown on May 20. The outage caused a halt in exports from the firm’s 7.2 mtpa LNG export plant.
Author: CK

Title: Argentina is seen buying more LNG to ensure adequate domestic gas supplies
Description: Argentina will buy more LNG as part of a set of measures to ensure priority gas users are well supplied and power supply in the domestic market is adequate amid expectations of lower-than-expected temperatures and already colder-than-normal weather.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand’s PTT issues a tender seeking three more July LNG cargoes
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT is seeking three more LNG cargoes for delivery in July through a tender that closes on May 30. The delivery windows are Jul. 3-4, 11-14 and 18-19.
Author: CK

Title: PipeChina’s Zhangzhou LNG terminal starts commissioning phase with receipt of first cargo
Description: The 3 mtpa Zhangzhou LNG receiving terminal in China’s southeastern province of Fujian has begun its commissioning phase following the arrival of the 173,400 m3 Macoma LNG tanker. The terminal, once commissioned, will be the first newly built LNG import facility to be put into operation in China this year.
Author: CK
